Academic_PeriodObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Academic_PeriodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_PeriodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

description: Academic Period Date Control Request Reference

Academic_PeriodObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_PeriodObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Academic_Period_Date_Control_Request_Cri.description: Academic Period Reference - leave blank to get all Academic Period Date Controls for all periods

Academic_UnitObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Academic_UnitObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_UnitObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Academic_Period_Date_Control_Request_Cri.description: Academic Unit reference - if specified, must be used in conjunction with Academic Level.  Academic Unit, Academic Level, and Program of Study can all be left blank to return all Date Controls for an Academic Period

Academic_LevelObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Academic_LevelObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Academic_LevelObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Academic_Period_Date_Control_Request_Cri.description: Academic Level reference - if specified, must be used in conjunction with Academic Unit.  Academic Unit, Academic Level, and Program of Study can all be left blank to return all Date Controls for an Academic Period

Program_of_StudyObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Program_of_StudyObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Program_of_StudyObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Academic_Period_Date_Control_Request_Cri.description: Program of Study reference.  Academic Unit, Academic Level, and Program of Study can all be left blank to return all Date Controls for an Academic Period

description: Criteria to apply to Academic Period Date Controls for Get request

validation.validation: Specify an Academic Period for the academic unit and level configuration or for the program of study.
Specify an academic level that exists for this academic unit.
Specify either an academic unit and level or a program of study. You can’t specify both.
Specify a program of study that is stand-alone.

Response_Filter.description: Indicates the date when application data, such as benefits and compensation, become effective (Also referred to as the Effective Moment). If you don't specify a date, this date defaults to today.{+4}
The date and time the data was entered into the system. (This field is also referred to as the Entry Moment). If the date isn't specified, the default date is the current date and time.

The numbered page of data Workday returns in the response. The default page is the first page(Page = 1). For responses that contain more than one page of data, use this parameter to retrieve the additional pages of data. For example, set Page = 2 to retrieve the second page of data.Note: If you set the page parameter, you must also specify the "As_Of_Entry_Date" to ensure that the result set remains the same between your requests.
Sets the number of objects to return within each response page. Set a value between 1 and 999. The default value is 100.

description: Parameters that let you filter the data returned in the response. You can filter returned data by dates and page attributes.
